data.event: The county celebrated its 275th anniversary in 2009.

event.title: was inhabited for thousands of years

data.event: The area was inhabited for thousands of years by various cultures of indigenous peoples.

event.title: settled 12 immigrant families from Westphalia, Germany there in 1714

data.event: The first European settlement in what was to become Orange County was Germanna, formed when Governor Alexander Spotswood settled 12 immigrant families from Westphalia, Germany there in 1714; a total of 42 people.
Orange County, as a legal entity, was created in August 1734 when the Virginia House of Burgesses adopted “An Act for Dividing Spotsylvania County.”
This situation lasted only four years; in 1738 most of the western tract was split off into Augusta County.

event.title: 1738 most of the western tract was split off

data.event: This situation lasted only four years; in 1738 most of the western tract was split off into Augusta County.
